title: Is this punishable? if not, it should be.
body:
After like 15 minutes into the game, I had this exchange with a kleptomancy kled jungler (cause he finally realized I have teleport.)

Player: Why do you have tp?
Venompaw: Because heal sucks
Player: Having downs sux

I did report it after game. i was playing Kai'sa as adc at that time with teleport /flash.

I reported it under verbal abuse / hate speech.

replies.body:
So.. this is going to be a grey area (as is many things).

On one hand, you can interpret that as "you have downs and you suck" - which would certainly be a form of hate speech. This is, in fact, the first thing I saw.. but then I was like "how am I making that connection from [heal/tp] to [downs/you]". While I'm decently certain that they intended to imply you had downs, I don't think it's that clear so as to be able to say with certainty they weren't just making a general statement. Personally, if I were a support agent handling this report, I'd look back through this player's other recent games/reported games and see if they make a habit of "skirting the line" like this, and if so I'd issue a punishment.

My recommendation is to submit a ticket and ask them to look into it - but don't be surprised if the evidence isn't there to support escalating this to a punishment based off this one line of chat.

But telling someone to "KYS" one time is bannable, is this also a grey area?

"kys" means one thing and one thing only: "kill yourself".

If you tell someone to kill themselves, or if you become the mouthpiece for someone to do so through (ex: by repeating them saying it), that is in no way a grey area.

He might be referring to himself
Or making a dark joke
Who knows? 
I don't think the line was crossed - There is much worse than that out on the rift xD
So because someone has done worse, this is ok. Got it.
